The purpose of the Merrelles project is to create a sly Nine Men's Morris opponent that is "write once run anywhere".

          Description

Packages
org.pesullivan.game.game42 Provides generic classes that generate deterministic 2 player strategy game behaviour.
org.pesullivan.game.mill.engine Supplies business logic for playing Nine Men's Morris.
org.pesullivan.game.mill.ui A UI for playing Nine Men's Morris.

 

The purpose of the Merrelles project is to create a sly Nine Men's Morris opponent that is "write once run anywhere". The author, Paul Sullivan, first played Nine Men's Morris in Lausanne, Switzerland, where a Morris board is built into the pavement at Place de la Riponne. An important goal of this project is to create a game that is equally appealing.

org.pesullivan.game Classes and Interfaces (public only)

N.B. All static members are constant.
